titleStmt.title: L. C. Rankin et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5015

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Governor Thos. E. Bramlette your petitioner would respectfully represent that at the present May Term 1864 of the Harrison Circuit Court J. P. Robinson was tried upon an indictment for keeping a tipling house for 3 months and was found guilty of keeping a tipling house and fined sixty dollars: The evidence showed that one J. A. Earles had obtained from the Harrison County Court a licese to keep a tavern & retail liquors at his tavern house in the county of Harrison and after taking out his license took took in J. P. Robinson as a partner under the impression that the business could be carried in under Earles' license all of the retailing by Robinson was done under Earles' license believing said facts present a proper case for the exercise of executive Clemency We the jurors who tried the case & members of the bar what heard the trail respectfully ask that the fine be remitted

L C Rankin
Samuel Levergene
Wm Hutcherson
L D Terry
Wm R Mc Nees
E D McAdams
W B Renaker
Robert Reneker
L J Davis
Adam Renaker
H Cal
Hugh M Leer
Members of the bar
W W Simble
J. S. Boyd
Jno R Smith
Jno T. McClintock
J L Griffith
J F Ware. C H C. Court
J.H. Marshalll
A. H. Ward

Harrison Cir Ct
vs
J. P. Robinson
Remit Execept fees & costs & enclose care of A. H. Ward Cynthiana Ky --
